org.opentcs.access

Interface LocalKernel

  • All Superinterfaces:
    EventSource<TCSEvent>, Kernel, Lifecycle

    public interface LocalKernel
extends Kernel, Lifecycle
    Declares the methods the openTCS kernel must provide which are not accessible to remote peers.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.opentcs.access.Kernel

        Kernel.State

      • Fields inherited from interface org.opentcs.access.Kernel

    • Method Detail

      • loadPlantModel

        void loadPlantModel()
             throws CredentialsException,
                    java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Loads the saved model into the kernel. If there is no saved model, a new empty model will be loaded.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the model cannot be loaded.
        CredentialsException - If the calling client is not allowed to execute this method.

      • savePlantModel

        void savePlantModel()
             throws CredentialsException,
                    java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Saves the current model under the given name. If there is a saved model, it will be overwritten.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the model could not be persisted for some reason.
        CredentialsException - If the calling client is not allowed to execute this method.

      • getTCSObjectOriginal

        <T extends TCSObject<T>> T getTCSObjectOriginal(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                                                TCSObjectReference<T> ref)
                                         throws CredentialsException
        Returns a single TCSObject of the given class.

        Note: This method returns the original object(s) as existing within the kernel, not a copy. When working with the result, be aware its contents may change over time as the kernel modifies it, and that modifying its contents directly instead of using the appropriate kernel methods may lead to unpredictable results. This method should only be used when the performance impact of copying objects is inacceptable and the above implications are handled appropriately.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The TCSObject's actual type.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class of the object to be returned.
        ref - A reference to the object to be returned.
        Returns:
        The referenced object, or null if no such object exists or if an object exists but is not an instance of the given class.
        Throws:
        CredentialsException - If the calling client is not allowed to execute this method.

      • getTCSObjectOriginal

        <T extends TCSObject<T>> T getTCSObjectOriginal(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                                                java.lang.String name)
                                         throws CredentialsException
        Returns a single TCSObject of the given class.

        Note: This method returns the original object(s) as existing within the kernel, not a copy. When working with the result, be aware its contents may change over time as the kernel modifies it, and that modifying its contents directly instead of using the appropriate kernel methods may lead to unpredictable results. This method should only be used when the performance impact of copying objects is inacceptable and the above implications are handled appropriately.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The TCSObject's actual type.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class of the object to be returned.
        name - The name of the object to be returned.
        Returns:
        The named object, or null if no such object exists or if an object exists but is not an instance of the given class.
        Throws:
        CredentialsException - If the calling client is not allowed to execute this method.

      • getTCSObjectsOriginal

        <T extends TCSObject<T>> java.util.Set<T> getTCSObjectsOriginal(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
                                                         throws CredentialsException
        Returns all existing TCSObjects of the given class.

        Note: This method returns the original object(s) as existing within the kernel, not a copy. When working with the result, be aware its contents may change over time as the kernel modifies it, and that modifying its contents directly instead of using the appropriate kernel methods may lead to unpredictable results. This method should only be used when the performance impact of copying objects is inacceptable and the above implications are handled appropriately.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The TCSObjects' actual type.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class of the objects to be returned.
        Returns:
        All existing objects of the given class.
        Throws:
        CredentialsException - If the calling client is not allowed to execute this method.

      • getTCSObjectsOriginal

        <T extends TCSObject<T>> java.util.Set<T> getTCSObjectsOriginal(@Nullable
                                                                java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                                                                java.util.regex.Pattern regexp)
                                                         throws CredentialsException
        Returns all existing TCSObjects of the given class whose names match the given pattern.

        Note: This method returns the original object(s) as existing within the kernel, not a copy. When working with the result, be aware its contents may change over time as the kernel modifies it, and that modifying its contents directly instead of using the appropriate kernel methods may lead to unpredictable results. This method should only be used when the performance impact of copying objects is inacceptable and the above implications are handled appropriately.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The TCSObjects' actual type.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class of the objects to be returned.
        regexp - A regular expression describing the names of the objects to be returned; if null, all objects of the given class are returned.
        Returns:
        All existing objects of the given class whose names match the given pattern. If no such objects exist, the returned set will be empty.
        Throws:
        CredentialsException - If the calling client is not allowed to execute this method.

      • setTransportOrderState

        void setTransportOrderState(TCSObjectReference<TransportOrder> ref,
                            TransportOrder.State newState)
                     throws ObjectUnknownException
        Sets a transport order's state. Note that transport order states are intended to be manipulated by the dispatcher only. Calling this method from any other parts of the kernel may result in undefined behaviour.
        Parameters:
        ref - A reference to the transport order to be modified.
        newState - The transport order's new state.
        Throws:
        ObjectUnknownException - If the referenced transport order does not exist.

                                 throws ObjectUnknownException

      • setTransportOrderDriveOrders

        void setTransportOrderDriveOrders(TCSObjectReference<TransportOrder> orderRef,
                                  java.util.List<DriveOrder> newOrders)
                           throws ObjectUnknownException,
                                  CredentialsException,
                                  java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets drive order data from for the given transport order.
        Parameters:
        orderRef - A reference to the transport order to be modified.
        newOrders - The drive orders containing the data to be copied into this transport order's drive orders.
        Throws:
        ObjectUnknownException - If the referenced transport order is not in this pool.
        CredentialsException - If the calling client is not allowed to execute this method.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the destinations of the given drive orders do not match the destinations of the drive orders in this transport order.

      • setTransportOrderInitialDriveOrder

        void setTransportOrderInitialDriveOrder(TCSObjectReference<TransportOrder> ref)
                                 throws ObjectUnknownException,
                                        java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Sets a transport order's initial drive order. Makes the first of the future drive orders the current one for the given transport order. Fails if there already is a current drive order or if the list of future drive orders is empty.
        Parameters:
        ref - A reference to the transport order to be modified.
        Throws:
        ObjectUnknownException - If the referenced transport order does not exist.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If there already is a current drive order or if the list of future drive orders is empty.

      • setTransportOrderNextDriveOrder

        void setTransportOrderNextDriveOrder(TCSObjectReference<TransportOrder> ref)
                              throws ObjectUnknownException
        Updates a transport order's current drive order. Marks the current drive order as finished, adds it to the list of past drive orders and sets the current drive order to the next one of the list of future drive orders (or null, if that list is empty). If the current drive order is null because all drive orders have been finished already or none has been started, yet, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        ref - A reference to the transport order to be modified.
        Throws:
        ObjectUnknownException - If the referenced transport order is not in this pool.

 @ScheduledApiChange(when="5.0",

      • expandResources

        java.util.Set<TCSResource<?>> expandResources(java.util.Set<TCSResourceReference<?>> resources)
                                       throws ObjectUnknownException,
                                              CredentialsException
        Expands a set of resources A to a set of resources B. B contains the resources in A with blocks expanded to their actual members. The given set is not modified.
        Parameters:
        resources - The set of resources to be expanded.
        Returns:
        The given set with resources expanded.
        Throws:
        ObjectUnknownException - If any of the referenced objects does not exist.
        CredentialsException - If the calling client is not allowed to execute this method.

      • getConfigurationItems

        @Deprecated
 @ScheduledApiChange(when="5.0",
                    details="Will be removed.")
java.util.Set<ConfigurationItemTO> getConfigurationItems()
                                                                                                                                                  throws CredentialsException
        Deprecated. Configuration management is out of scope for the kernel.
        Returns all configuration items existing in the kernel.
        Returns:
        All configuration items existing in the kernel.
        Throws:
        CredentialsException - If the calling client is not allowed to execute this method.

      • setConfigurationItem

        @Deprecated
 @ScheduledApiChange(when="5.0",
                    details="Will be removed.")
void setConfigurationItem(ConfigurationItemTO itemTO)
                                                                                                                   throws CredentialsException
        Deprecated. Configuration management is out of scope for the kernel.
        Sets a single configuration item in the kernel.
        Parameters:
        itemTO - The configuration item to be set.
        Throws:
        CredentialsException - If the calling client is not allowed to execute this method.
